description: Helena Vieira da Silva moved from her native Portugal for Paris, where she worked with such artists as Fernand Léger and began incorporating abstraction into her work. Looking at the work of Joaquín Torres García and Pierre Bonnard, as well as the azulejos (floor and wall tiles) of Portugal, she developed a distinct style that balances the organic and familiar, the hermetic and strange.
artist_info:
Maria Helena Vieira da Silva
French
born Portugal, 1908–1992
title: Composition
